title: [feature request]Allow JIT compiler to compile functions with docstrings
body_html:
Hi, Just want to know if it is contribute welcome to add support for docstrings into pytorch? A simple code to show what I want is below:

import torch

@torch.jit.script
def f(x):
    """Plus one, then square it"""
    p1 = x + 1
    """The intermediate result storing x + 1"""
    return p1 * p1

print(f(torch.randn(2,2)))

Currently, this code would fail with error:

torch.jit.frontend.UnsupportedNodeError: Str aren't supported
@torch.jit.script
def f(x):
    """Plus one, then square it"""
    ~ <--- HERE
    p1 = x + 1
    """The intermediate result storing x + 1"""
    return p1 * p1

What I want to do is to allow docstrings in the function by:

  • Silently remove docstrings for local names
  • Extract the docstring of the entire function and make it the docstring of the returned function.

body:
Hi, Just want to know if it is contribute welcome to add support for docstrings into pytorch? A simple code to show what I want is below:
```python
import torch

@torch.jit.script
def f(x):
    """Plus one, then square it"""
    p1 = x + 1
    """The intermediate result storing x + 1"""
    return p1 * p1

print(f(torch.randn(2,2)))
```
Currently, this code would fail with error:
```
torch.jit.frontend.UnsupportedNodeError: Str aren't supported
@torch.jit.script
def f(x):
    """Plus one, then square it"""
    ~ <--- HERE
    p1 = x + 1
    """The intermediate result storing x + 1"""
    return p1 * p1
```
What I want to do is to allow docstrings in the function by:
* Silently remove docstrings for local names
* Extract the docstring of the entire function and make it the docstring of the returned function.
